results.title: Paths of glory
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, James B. Harris, Bryna Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s World War One drama is a compelling anti-war film about the absurdities and horrors of war. Based on Humphrey Cobb’s novel, and co-written by Kubrick and Jim Thompson, ‘Paths of glory’ looks at the political machinations and power plays that ultimately decide who lives and dies in times of war, the cost and meaning of a life reduced to mere numbers and strategic manoeuvre. Set amongst the trenches and later on the decadent Chateau’s occupied by the French army’s elite, the films central courtroom drama focuses on the efforts of Colonel Dax (Kirk Douglas) to free three French soldiers (Joseph Turkel, Timothy Carey and Ralph Meeker) accused of cowardice for wisely retreating from a suicide mission to storm an Ant Hill occupied by the German army. Kubrick views the efforts of the French military to condemn these innocent men to death with detached bitter irony, leaving the films powerful message for it’s moving closing moments. Cast includes George Macready, Adolphe Menjou, Wayne Morris, Richard Anderson

results.title: Full metal jacket
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s disturbing and darkly funny Vietnam war drama about the dehumanizing process involved in turning young men into trained killers is divided into two distinct acts. Based on Gustav Hasford’s “The Short-Timers”, the first part focuses on the slow descent into madness of a young recruit in basic training, Private Gomer Pyle (Vincent D’Onofrio). He undergoes a process of systematic torture, verbal abuse and cruel disciplinary measures administered by a sadistic drill Sergeant (Lee Emery). The second part shows the bastardization process in action as it follows Private Joker (Mathew Modine) as he navigates himself around the madness and senselessness of the Vietnam war. This isn’t the first time Kubrick has dealt with the inhumanities of war, having tackled similar themes in the brilliant ‘Paths of Glory’. With ‘Full Metal Jacket’ however, he achieves in presenting an absurd and chilling vision of hell on earth. Cast also includes Adam Baldwin, Arliss Howard, Dorian Harewood and Kevyn Major Hasford. Original music by Abigail Mead (Kubrick’s daughter Vivian Kubrick).

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

results.title: The Ernie game
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Gordon Burwash, Robert Allen and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A mid-winter romantic feature filmed in Montreal, although the story could take place in any city where those young people live who have left their parents’ homes but still have not made homes of their own. Ernie’s alienation is far more extreme than most. For him life is a game, not because he chooses to make it so, but because he is unable to make anything more of it. But for those who befriend him and eventually turn him loose again, his game is not enough. (Awards: Toronto; Barcelona.) Cast: Jackie Burroughs, Anna Cameron, Leonard Cohen, Corinne Copnick, Roland D’Amour, Judith Gault, Alexis Kanner, Derek May, Louis Negin.

results.title: In the winter dark
results.creator_credit: James Bogle, Rosemary Blight, Film Finance Corporation Australia and R B Films
results.brief_description: Maurice Stubbs has a heavy heart, remorse and broken dreams consume him as someone or something is slowly killing the animals, disembowelling them in fact, around his secluded farm. His usual sense of total isolation is heightened by the inexplicable events that are occurring, and contradict the notion of an idyllic country existence. Maurice, along with his wife Ida and two other frightened residents, city fugitive Jacob and modern city girl Ronnie form an uneasy alliance in search of things they do not know, in places they should not be. For to confront the beast that seems to have no tangible existence is to confront their own internal demons. Based on the novel of the same name by Tim Winton. Cast includes Brenda Blethyn, Ray Barrett, Richard Roxburgh and Miranda Otto.

results.title: 12 Angry men
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Terence A. Donnelly and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A young man is accused of fatally stabbing his father, and his fate now lies in the hands of his “peers”: 12 men from all walks of life, different backgrounds, who all bring their own agendas and prejudices with them. Is he innocent or guilty? Is there reasonable doubt? The tension mounts as each piece of evidence is examined again and again. This film provides the viewer with an insight into the American legal system and what may happen behind the scenes of any murder trial. This is an emotionally charged courtroom drama with a star studded cast including Courtney B Vance, Ossie Davis, George C Scott, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Dorian Harewood, James Gandolfini, Tony Danza, Jack Lemon, Hume Croyn, Mykelti Williamson, Edward James and Olmas William Peterson.

results.title: Microcosmos
results.creator_credit: Claude Nuridsany, Marie Perennou, Jacques Perrin, Bac Films (France), Galatee Films and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: ‘Microcosmos’ is a visually spectacular exploration of a hidden world as vast as our own. Marvel at the lush colour and clarity of the images presented; dew glittering on a spider’s web, a riot of red poppies bursting open, an undulating parade of caterpillars, a cocoon splitting to release a butterfly, the deadly embrace of a carnivorous plant. Track the movements of a bee as it courts a flower, or experience the collective terror of a nest of ants as they face a hungry predator. This film is an anthropological metaphor for human evolution, constantly juxtaposing our world with that of the microcosmos. Fifteen years of research, two years of equipment design and three years of filming were required to bring this film to life.

results.title: Cats
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Andrew Lloyd Webber and Really Useful Films
results.brief_description: ‘Cats’ is the longest-running musical in the history of the London West End and Broadway Theatre. The musical exploded onto the West End in 1981 and became an instant hit world wide, with “Memory” one of it’s classic and recognisable songs. Based on “Old Possum’s book of practical cats” by T.S. Eliot - CATS is a stunning production with a star studded cast including Elaine Paige and Sir John Mills. The costumes and choreography are superb, effectively transforming humans into felines. Using the latest technology, all the excitement, thrill, romance and intimacy of this theatrical legend is captured on screen. With breathtaking visuals and full digital sound from a 70 piece orchestra, one is lead into the mysterious world of cats.

results.title: Sliding doors
results.creator_credit: Peter Howitt, Philippa Braithwaite, Sydney Pollack, William Horberg, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Losing her job triggers a strange turn of events for Helen (Gwyneth Paltrow) when she discovers two possibilities for her future. These possibilities are based on the sliding door which signifies whether she catches or misses the train home, and these two scenarios are followed in a parallel sequence. In the world in which she misses her train, Helen works hard at menial jobs to support herself and her unfaithful, writer boyfriend Gerry (John Lynch). In the world in which she catches the train, Helen discovers that getting over discovering Gerry’s infidelity is not as bad as she thought when she begins a relationship with James (John Hannah). Through her happiness however comes unexpected confusion, as nothing is as it seems on the surface. Ultimately the two worlds coalesce, but only one man can accompany her into the future. Cast includes Jean Tripplehorn, Zara Turner and Douglas McFerran.

results.title: Help! with the Beatles
results.creator_credit: Richard Lester, Walter Shenson, Subafilms and Walter Shenson Films
results.brief_description: Help! with The Beatles is an example of the evolution of the MTV pop video generation. The film’s plot revolves around a strange sacrificial ring which mysteriously finds its way onto Ringo’s finger. He can’t get the ring off and a group of Indian mystics (led by Leo McKern) start to stalk the Beatles in their attempts to get the ring back. The plot scenarios are pretty silly, although it’s fun to see the quintessentially sixties decor and clothes. The main attraction to “Help!” is of course the Beatles’ songs which play like pop videos. Included in the film are; “Help!”, “You’ve Got to Hide Your Love Away”, “Ticket to Ride”, “Another Girl”, “I Need You” and “The Night Before”.

results.title: Sinnui yauman (A Chinese Ghost Story)
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Cinema City Co, Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Leslie Cheung stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Cinema City Co, Film Workshop
results.description: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
